channel.title: Comments on: A More Fluid Web

item.title: By: Gail Persily
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/staff.library.ucsf.edu/2014/09/04/a-more-fluid-web/#comment-316">Michele Mizejewski</a>.
Yes, we'll need to take that into account. So the important stuff does not disappear. Right now we are using those secondary boxes in a somewhat random fashion. This will require us to define a hierarchy of importance. Sounds good.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Michele Mizejewski.

Yes, we’ll need to take that into account. So the important stuff does not disappear. Right now we are using those secondary boxes in a somewhat random fashion. This will require us to define a hierarchy of importance. Sounds good.

item.title: By: Michele Mizejewski
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/staff.library.ucsf.edu/2014/09/04/a-more-fluid-web/#comment-315">Gail Persily</a>.
Yes, when the window gets small enough, the secondary boxes on the right disappear now. The long term plan is probably to trim those down to only the truly useful in context and have them appear under the primary content. Many pages could benefit from having fewer choices and more focus.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Gail Persily.

Yes, when the window gets small enough, the secondary boxes on the right disappear now. The long term plan is probably to trim those down to only the truly useful in context and have them appear under the primary content. Many pages could benefit from having fewer choices and more focus.

item.title: By: Gail Persily
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description: Great to see that you are starting to tackle the responsiveness challenge! We noticed that some of the blocks e.g. See Also, disappear on the smaller screens. Is the long term plan for them to move to the bottom on tablets and phones?
item.content:encoded: Great to see that you are starting to tackle the responsiveness challenge! We noticed that some of the blocks e.g. See Also, disappear on the smaller screens. Is the long term plan for them to move to the bottom on tablets and phones?

item.title: By: Mark Bridge
item.dc:creator: Mark Bridge
item.description: Wow, this is an incredibly challenging effort. Well done for going for it, can't wait to see the improvements as the project progresses.
item.content:encoded: Wow, this is an incredibly challenging effort. Well done for going for it, can’t wait to see the improvements as the project progresses.
